quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
author: Plato

quote: Nature does nothing in vain.
author: Aristotle

quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Socrates

quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

quote: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
author: Confucius

quote: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
author: Laozi

quote: To a mind that is still, the entire universe surrenders.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: Flow with whatever may happen, and let your mind be free.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: You have power over your mind â€“ not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
author: Cicero

quote: The ends justify the means.
author: Machiavelli

quote: One's conscience is the sole judge of one's actions.
author: Thomas More

quote: Man is a great miracle.
author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola

quote: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
author: Laozi

quote: Do not impose on others what you yourself do not desire.
author: Confucius

quote: Respond intelligently even to unintelligent treatment.
author: Laozi

quote: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

quote: Act without expectation.
author: Laozi

quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Laozi

quote: To see things in the seed, that is genius.
author: Laozi

quote: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
author: Laozi

quote: Flow with whatever may happen and let your mind be free.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: To a mind that is still, the entire universe surrenders.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are.
author: Laozi

quote: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Laozi

quote: Knowing others is wisdom; knowing yourself is enlightenment.
author: Laozi

quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: The Buddha

quote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: The Buddha

quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: The Buddha

quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
author: The Buddha

quote: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
author: The Buddha

quote: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind.
author: The Buddha

quote: Do not overrate what you have received, nor envy others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
author: The Buddha

quote: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
author: The Buddha

quote: It is better to travel well than to arrive.
author: The Buddha

quote: A jug fills drop by drop.
author: The Buddha

quote: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.
author: The Buddha

quote: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
author: The Buddha

quote: An unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

quote: Education is the kindling of a flame, not the filling of a vessel.
author: Socrates

quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

quote: At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.
author: Plato

quote: Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the laws.
author: Plato

quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Aristotle

quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

quote: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
author: Aristotle

quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Seneca

quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

quote: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
author: Seneca

quote: Life is like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.
author: Seneca

quote: True happiness is... to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
author: Seneca

quote: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
author: Seneca

quote: Constant exposure to dangers will breed contempt for them.
author: Seneca

quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

quote: Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.
author: Seneca

quote: All cruelty springs from weakness.
author: Seneca

quote: Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.
author: Seneca

quote: Difficulty comes from our lack of confidence.
author: Seneca

quote: Man is his own worst enemy.
author: Cicero

quote: Any man can make mistakes, but only an idiot persists in his error.
author: Cicero

quote: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
author: Cicero

quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
author: Cicero

quote: Silence is one of the great arts of conversation.
author: Cicero

quote: Live as brave men; and if fortune is adverse, front its blows with brave hearts.
author: Cicero

quote: Natural ability without education has more often raised a man to glory and virtue than education without natural ability.
author: Cicero

quote: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.
author: Cicero

quote: Freedom is a possession of inestimable value.
author: Cicero

quote: Justice is the set and constant purpose which gives every man his due.
author: Cicero

quote: Virtue is its own reward.
author: Cicero

quote: Times are bad. Children no longer obey their parents, and everyone is writing a book.
author: Cicero

quote: To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child.
author: Cicero

quote: Memory is the treasury and guardian of all things.
author: Cicero
